00284 /* Mirror types to GL types. Mirror types allow us to avoid deciding which headers to load based on whether we are using GL or GLES here. */
00285 typedef unsigned int cl_GLuint;
00286 typedef int          cl_GLint;
00287 typedef unsigned int cl_GLenum;
00288 
00289 /*
00290  * Vector types 
00291  *
00292  *  Note:   OpenCL requires that all types be naturally aligned. 
00293  *          This means that vector types must be naturally aligned.
00294  *          For example, a vector of four floats must be aligned to
00295  *          a 16 byte boundary (calculated as 4 * the natural 4-byte 
00296  *          alignment of the float).  The alignment qualifiers here
00297  *          will only function properly if your compiler supports them
00298  *          and if you don't actively work to defeat them.  For example,
00299  *          in order for a cl_float4 to be 16 byte aligned in a struct,
00300  *          the start of the struct must itself be 16-byte aligned. 
00301  *
00302  *          Maintaining proper alignment is the user's responsibility.
00303  */
00304 
00305 
00306 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00307 #if defined(_M_IX86)
00308 #if _M_IX86_FP >= 0
00309 #define __SSE__
00310 #endif
00311 #if _M_IX86_FP >= 1
00312 #define __SSE2__
00313 #endif
00314 #elif defined(_M_X64)
00315 #define __SSE__
00316 #define __SSE2__
00317 #endif
00318 #endif

00325    typedef vector unsigned short    __cl_ushort8;
00326    typedef vector signed short      __cl_short8;

00329    typedef vector float             __cl_float4;

00442 /* Define alignment keys */
00443 #if defined( __GNUC__ )
00444     #define CL_ALIGNED(_x)          __attribute__ ((aligned(_x)))
00445 #elif defined( _WIN32) && (_MSC_VER)
00446     /* Alignment keys neutered on windows because MSVC can't swallow function arguments with alignment requirements     */
00447     /* http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/373ak2y1%28VS.71%29.aspx                                                 */
00448     /* #include <crtdefs.h>                                                                                             */
00449     /* #define CL_ALIGNED(_x)          _CRT_ALIGN(_x)                                                                   */
00450     #define CL_ALIGNED(_x)
00451 #else
00452    #warning  Need to implement some method to align data here
00453    #define  CL_ALIGNED(_x)
00454 #endif

00456 /* Indicate whether .xyzw, .s0123 and .hi.lo are supported */
00457 #if (defined( __GNUC__) && ! defined( __STRICT_ANSI__ )) || (defined( _MSC_VER ) && ! defined( __STDC__ ))
00458     /* .xyzw and .s0123...{f|F} are supported */
00459     #define CL_HAS_NAMED_VECTOR_FIELDS 1
00460     /* .hi and .lo are supported */
00461     #define CL_HAS_HI_LO_VECTOR_FIELDS 1

00463     #define CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED
00464 #endif

00472 /* ---- cl_charn ---- */
00473 typedef union
00474 {
00475     cl_char  CL_ALIGNED(2) s[2];
00476 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
00477    __extension__ struct{ cl_char  x, y; };
00478    __extension__ struct{ cl_char  s0, s1; };
00479    __extension__ struct{ cl_char  lo, hi; };
00480 #endif
00481 #if defined( __CL_CHAR2__) 
00482     __cl_char2     v2;
00483 #endif
00484 }cl_char2;
00485 
00486 typedef union
00487 {
00488     cl_char  CL_ALIGNED(4) s[4];
00489 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
00490    __extension__ struct{ cl_char  x, y, z, w; };
00491    __extension__ struct{ cl_char  s0, s1, s2, s3; };
00492    __extension__ struct{ cl_char2 lo, hi; };
00493 #endif
00494 #if defined( __CL_CHAR2__) 
00495     __cl_char2     v2[2];

01064 #if defined( __CL_ULONG16__ )
01065     __cl_ulong16    v16;
01066 #endif
01067 }cl_ulong16;
01068 
01069 
01070 /* --- cl_floatn ---- */
01071 
01072 typedef union
01073 {
01074     cl_float  CL_ALIGNED(8) s[2];
01075 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
01076    __extension__ struct{ cl_float  x, y; };
01077    __extension__ struct{ cl_float  s0, s1; };
01078    __extension__ struct{ cl_float  lo, hi; };
01079 #endif
01080 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT2__) 
01081     __cl_float2     v2;
01082 #endif
01083 }cl_float2;
01084 
01085 typedef union
01086 {
01087     cl_float  CL_ALIGNED(16) s[4];
01088 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
01089    __extension__ struct{ cl_float   x, y, z, w; };
01090    __extension__ struct{ cl_float   s0, s1, s2, s3; };
01091    __extension__ struct{ cl_float2  lo, hi; };
01092 #endif
01093 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT2__) 
01094     __cl_float2     v2[2];
01095 #endif
01096 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT4__) 
01097     __cl_float4     v4;
01098 #endif
01099 }cl_float4;
01100 
01101 /* cl_float3 is identical in size, alignment and behavior to cl_float4. See section 6.1.5. */
01102 typedef  cl_float4  cl_float3;
01103

01105 {
01106     cl_float   CL_ALIGNED(32) s[8];
01107 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
01108    __extension__ struct{ cl_float   x, y, z, w; };
01109    __extension__ struct{ cl_float   s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, s5, s6, s7; };
01110    __extension__ struct{ cl_float4  lo, hi; };
01111 #endif
01112 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT2__) 
01113     __cl_float2     v2[4];
01114 #endif
01115 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT4__) 
01116     __cl_float4     v4[2];
01117 #endif
01118 #if defined( __CL_FLOAT8__ )
01119     __cl_float8     v8;
01120 #endif
01121 }cl_float8;
01122 
01123 typedef union
01124 {

01126 #if defined( CL_NAMED_STRUCT_SUPPORTED )
01127    __extension__ struct{ cl_float  x, y, z, w, __spacer4, __spacer5, __spacer6, __spacer7, __spacer8, __spacer9, sa, sb, sc, sd, se, sf; };
01128    __extension__ struct{ cl_float  s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, s5, s6, s7, s8, s9, sA, sB, sC, sD, sE, sF; };
01129    __extension__ struct{ cl_float8 lo, hi; };
01130 #endif

01202    __extension__ struct{ cl_double  x, y, z, w, __spacer4, __spacer5, __spacer6, __spacer7, __spacer8, __spacer9, sa, sb, sc, sd, se, sf; };
01203    __extension__ struct{ cl_double  s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, s5, s6, s7, s8, s9, sA, sB, sC, sD, sE, sF; };
01204    __extension__ struct{ cl_double8 lo, hi; };
01205 #endif

01208 #endif

01214 #endif

01216     __cl_double16    v16;
01217 #endif

01219 
01220 /* Macro to facilitate debugging 
01221  * Usage:
01222  *   Place CL_PROGRAM_STRING_DEBUG_INFO on the line before the first line of your source. 
01223  *   The first line ends with:   CL_PROGRAM_STRING_BEGIN \"
01224  *   Each line thereafter of OpenCL C source must end with: \n\
01225  *   The last line ends in ";
01226  *
01227  *   Example:
01228  *
01229  *   const char *my_program = CL_PROGRAM_STRING_BEGIN "\
01230  *   kernel void foo( int a, float * b )             \n\
01231  *   {                                               \n\
01232  *      // my comment                                \n\
01233  *      *b[ get_global_id(0)] = a;                   \n\
01234  *   }                                               \n\
01235  *   ";
01236  *
01237  * This should correctly set up the line, (column) and file information for your source 
01238  * string so you can do source level debugging.
01239  */
01240 #define  __CL_STRINGIFY( _x )               # _x
01241 #define  _CL_STRINGIFY( _x )                __CL_STRINGIFY( _x )
01242 #define  CL_PROGRAM_STRING_DEBUG_INFO       "#line "  _CL_STRINGIFY(__LINE__) " \"" __FILE__ "\" \n\n" 
01243

01374 #define CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU                          (1 << 1)
01375 #define CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU                          (1 << 2)
01376 #define CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR                  (1 << 3)
01377 #define CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ALL                          0xFFFFFFFF
01378 
01379 /* cl_device_info */

01381 #define CL_DEVICE_VENDOR_ID                         0x1001

01384 #define CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE               0x1004

01401 #define CL_DEVICE_IMAGE3D_MAX_DEPTH                 0x1015

01403 #define CL_DEVICE_MAX_PARAMETER_SIZE                0x1017
01404 #define CL_DEVICE_MAX_SAMPLERS                      0x1018

01407 #define CL_DEVICE_SINGLE_FP_CONFIG                  0x101B
01408 #define CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_TYPE             0x101C
01409 #define CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHELINE_SIZE         0x101D
01410 #define CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_SIZE             0x101E
01411 #define CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE                   0x101F

01413 #define CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_ARGS                 0x1021
01414 #define CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE                    0x1022
01415 #define CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE                    0x1023
01416 #define CL_DEVICE_ERROR_CORRECTION_SUPPORT          0x1024
01417 #define CL_DEVICE_PROFILING_TIMER_RESOLUTION        0x1025
01418 #define CL_DEVICE_ENDIAN_LITTLE                     0x1026
01419 #define CL_DEVICE_AVAILABLE                         0x1027
01420 #define CL_DEVICE_COMPILER_AVAILABLE                0x1028
01421 #define CL_DEVICE_EXECUTION_CAPABILITIES            0x1029
01422 #define CL_DEVICE_QUEUE_PROPERTIES                  0x102A
01423 #define CL_DEVICE_NAME                              0x102B
01424 #define CL_DEVICE_VENDOR                            0x102C
01425 #define CL_DRIVER_VERSION                           0x102D
01426 #define CL_DEVICE_PROFILE                           0x102E
01427 #define CL_DEVICE_VERSION                           0x102F
01428 #define CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS                        0x1030
01429 #define CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM                          0x1031
01430 /* 0x1032 reserved for CL_DEVICE_DOUBLE_FP_CONFIG */
01431 /* 0x1033 reserved for CL_DEVICE_HALF_FP_CONFIG */
01432 #define CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF       0x1034
01433 #define CL_DEVICE_HOST_UNIFIED_MEMORY               0x1035
01434 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR          0x1036
01435 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT         0x1037
01436 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT           0x1038
01437 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG          0x1039
01438 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT         0x103A
01439 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE        0x103B
01440 #define CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF          0x103C
01441 #define CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_VERSION                  0x103D
01442 
01443 /* cl_device_fp_config - bitfield */
01444 #define CL_FP_DENORM                                (1 << 0)
01445 #define CL_FP_INF_NAN                               (1 << 1)
01446 #define CL_FP_ROUND_TO_NEAREST                      (1 << 2)
01447 #define CL_FP_ROUND_TO_ZERO                         (1 << 3)
01448 #define CL_FP_ROUND_TO_INF                          (1 << 4)
01449 #define CL_FP_FMA                                   (1 << 5)
01450 #define CL_FP_SOFT_FLOAT                            (1 << 6)

01483

01488 #define CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR                         (1 << 3)
01489 #define CL_MEM_ALLOC_HOST_PTR                       (1 << 4)
01490 #define CL_MEM_COPY_HOST_PTR                        (1 << 5)

01499 #define CL_BGRA                                     0x10B6
01500 #define CL_ARGB                                     0x10B7

01502 #define CL_LUMINANCE                                0x10B9
01503 #define CL_Rx                                       0x10BA
01504 #define CL_RGx                                      0x10BB
01505 #define CL_RGBx                                     0x10BC
01506 
01507 /* cl_channel_type */

01509 #define CL_SNORM_INT16                              0x10D1
01510 #define CL_UNORM_INT8                               0x10D2

01513 #define CL_UNORM_SHORT_555                          0x10D5
01514 #define CL_UNORM_INT_101010                         0x10D6

01572 #define CL_PROGRAM_REFERENCE_COUNT                  0x1160
01573 #define CL_PROGRAM_CONTEXT                          0x1161
01574 #define CL_PROGRAM_NUM_DEVICES                      0x1162
01575 #define CL_PROGRAM_DEVICES                          0x1163
01576 #define CL_PROGRAM_SOURCE                           0x1164
01577 #define CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_SIZES                     0x1165
01578 #define CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES                         0x1166
01579 
01580 /* cl_program_build_info */
01581 #define CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_STATUS                     0x1181
01582 #define CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_OPTIONS                    0x1182
01583 #define CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG                        0x1183
01584 
01585 /* cl_build_status */
01586 #define CL_BUILD_SUCCESS                            0
01587 #define CL_BUILD_NONE                               -1
01588 #define CL_BUILD_ERROR                              -2
01589 #define CL_BUILD_IN_PROGRESS                        -3
01590 
01591 /* cl_kernel_info */
01592 #define CL_KERNEL_FUNCTION_NAME                     0x1190
01593 #define CL_KERNEL_NUM_ARGS                          0x1191
01594 #define CL_KERNEL_REFERENCE_COUNT                   0x1192
01595 #define CL_KERNEL_CONTEXT                           0x1193
01596 #define CL_KERNEL_PROGRAM                           0x1194
01597 
01598 /* cl_kernel_work_group_info */
01599 #define CL_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_SIZE                   0x11B0
01600 #define CL_KERNEL_COMPILE_WORK_GROUP_SIZE           0x11B1
01601 #define CL_KERNEL_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE                    0x11B2
01602 #define CL_KERNEL_PREFERRED_WORK_GROUP_SIZE_MULTIPLE 0x11B3
01603 #define CL_KERNEL_PRIVATE_MEM_SIZE                  0x11B4
01604 
01605 /* cl_event_info  */
01606 #define CL_EVENT_COMMAND_QUEUE                      0x11D0
01607 #define CL_EVENT_COMMAND_TYPE                       0x11D1
01608 #define CL_EVENT_REFERENCE_COUNT                    0x11D2
01609 #define CL_EVENT_COMMAND_EXECUTION_STATUS           0x11D3
01610 #define CL_EVENT_CONTEXT                            0x11D4
01611 
01612 /* cl_command_type */
01613 #define CL_COMMAND_NDRANGE_KERNEL                   0x11F0
01614 #define CL_COMMAND_TASK                             0x11F1
01615 #define CL_COMMAND_NATIVE_KERNEL                    0x11F2
01616 #define CL_COMMAND_READ_BUFFER                      0x11F3
01617 #define CL_COMMAND_WRITE_BUFFER                     0x11F4
01618 #define CL_COMMAND_COPY_BUFFER                      0x11F5
01619 #define CL_COMMAND_READ_IMAGE                       0x11F6
01620 #define CL_COMMAND_WRITE_IMAGE                      0x11F7
01621 #define CL_COMMAND_COPY_IMAGE                       0x11F8
01622 #define CL_COMMAND_COPY_IMAGE_TO_BUFFER             0x11F9
01623 #define CL_COMMAND_COPY_BUFFER_TO_IMAGE             0x11FA
01624 #define CL_COMMAND_MAP_BUFFER                       0x11FB
01625 #define CL_COMMAND_MAP_IMAGE                        0x11FC
01626 #define CL_COMMAND_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT                 0x11FD
01627 #define CL_COMMAND_MARKER                           0x11FE
01628 #define CL_COMMAND_ACQUIRE_GL_OBJECTS               0x11FF
01629 #define CL_COMMAND_RELEASE_GL_OBJECTS               0x1200
01630 #define CL_COMMAND_READ_BUFFER_RECT                 0x1201
01631 #define CL_COMMAND_WRITE_BUFFER_RECT                0x1202
01632 #define CL_COMMAND_COPY_BUFFER_RECT                 0x1203
01633 #define CL_COMMAND_USER                             0x1204
01634 
01635 /* command execution status */
01636 #define CL_COMPLETE                                 0x0
01637 #define CL_RUNNING                                  0x1
01638 #define CL_SUBMITTED                                0x2
01639 #define CL_QUEUED                                   0x3
01640

02181 // Extension function access
02182 //
02183 // Returns the extension function address for the given function name,
02184 // or NULL if a valid function can not be found.  The client must
02185 // check to make sure the address is not NULL, before using or 
02186 // calling the returned function address.
02187 //
02188 typedef CL_API_ENTRY void * (CL_API_CALL * PFNCLGETEXTENSIONFUNCTIONADDRESS)(const char * /* func_name */) CL_API_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_0;

02304 #ifdef CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS
02305 #warning CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS is defined. These APIs are unsupported and untested in OpenCL 1.1!
02306 /* 
02307  *  WARNING:
02308  *     This API introduces mutable state into the OpenCL implementation. It has been REMOVED
02309  *  to better facilitate thread safety.  The 1.0 API is not thread safe. It is not tested by the
02310  *  OpenCL 1.1 conformance test, and consequently may not work or may not work dependably.
02311  *  It is likely to be non-performant. Use of this API is not advised. Use at your own risk.
02312  *
02313  *  Software developers previously relying on this API are instructed to set the command queue 
02314  *  properties when creating the queue, instead. 
02315  */
02316 #define clSetCommandQueueProperty       CLEW_GET_FUN(__clewSetCommandQueueProperty       )
02317 #endif /* CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS */
